import requests
import json
import re
import pandas as pd
from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import CountVectorizer
def text(text):
    if isinstance(text, str):
        return text.lower()  # Example: Convert text to lowercase
    return text  # If not a string, return as is
baseURL = "https://newsapi.org/v2/everything?"
total_requests = 2
verbose = True
API_KEY = ['ab5b4817320d445a8b369a95be58c90a']
TOPIC = ['fiscal policy', 'macroeconomic']

post1 = {
    'apiKey': API_KEY,
    'q': '+' + TOPIC[0],
    'sortBy': 'relevancy',
    'totalRequests': 1
}

post2 = {
    'apiKey': API_KEY,
    'q': '+' + TOPIC[1],
    'sortBy': 'relevancy',
    'totalRequests': 1
}
def dumpjson(baseURL,URLpost):
    response = requests.get(baseURL, URLpost)
    return response.json()

fiscalpolicy = dumpjson(baseURL,post1)
macroeconomic = dumpjson(baseURL,post2)
print(fiscalpolicy)

file2_path = '/Users/sheebamoghal/Desktop/DSAN5000/dsan-5000-project-msheeba4848/dsan-website/5000-website/data/macroeconomicraw.json'

for data, filename in data_and_files:
    with open(filename, 'w') as fp:
        json.dump(data, fp)

def text(text):
    if isinstance(text, str):
        return text.lower()  # Example: Convert text to lowercase
    return text  # If not a string, return as is

fiscalpolicy['articles'] = fiscalpolicy['articles'].apply(lambda article: {
    'source': article.get('source'),
    'title': text(article.get('title')),
    'description': text(article.get('description'))
})

print(fiscalpolicy)

macroeconomic['articles'] = macroeconomic['articles'].apply(lambda article: {
    'source': article.get('source'),
    'title': text(article.get('title')),
    'description': text(article.get('description'))
})

from sklearn.feature_extraction.text import CountVectorizer

def countvectorizer(corpus):
    vectorizer = CountVectorizer()
    X = vectorizer.fit_transform(corpus)
    feature_names = vectorizer.get_feature_names_out()
    return feature_names, X.toarray()

# Define your corpora
fiscalpolicy_title_corpus = fiscalpolicy['articles'].apply(lambda x: x['title']).to_list()
fiscalpolicy_description_corpus = fiscalpolicy['articles'].apply(lambda x: x['description']).to_list()
macroeconomic_title_corpus = macroeconomic['articles'].apply(lambda x: x['title']).to_list()
macroeconomic_description_corpus = macroeconomic['articles'].apply(lambda x: x['description']).to_list()


# Perform count vectorization and print the results
print("-------------NewsAPI Corpus Count Vectorized-------------")
print(countvectorizer(fiscalpolicy_title_corpus))
print(countvectorizer(fiscalpolicy_description_corpus))
print(countvectorizer(macroeconomic_title_corpus))
print(countvectorizer(macroeconomic_description_corpus))
